alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 05 at 3:49AM EDT until April 06 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch, sleet accumulations around one half of an inch and ice accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, Interior DownEast, and Penobscot Valley Maine * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 6 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Expect slippery roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
